title: Singapore MAS to require investors to report short positions on SGX stocks
text:
May 28, 2018 / 10:14 AM / Updated 22 minutes ago Singapore MAS to require investors to report short positions on SGX stocks Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
SINGAPORE, May 28 (Reuters) - Singaporeâ€™s central bank said on Monday it will require investors to report short positions and short sell orders in securities listed on the Singapore Exchange effective Oct. 1 to improve transparency on such activities.
Under the new rules, investors with short positions above the threshold of the lower of 0.2 percent of total issued shares or S$2 million ($1.49 million) will have to report the positions to the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). $1 = 1.3400 Singapore dollars Reporting by Jack Kim Editing by Jacqueline Wong
